e4: Adopting the new policy is ethically superior, promoting transparency and accurate financial reporting. Although it might cause initial market uncertainty,  long-term benefits from increased investor trust and confidence will outweigh the short-term risks.  The current policy, while seemingly beneficial, is ethically questionable and unsustainable.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy.  It provides a fair and unbiased representation of the company's financial performance, avoiding any manipulation or intentional misrepresentation to influence investor perception.  It also considers the potential impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors who may be more vulnerable to manipulation, ensuring equitable access to information.
e6: I would ask about the specific strategies the investor relations team plans to use to communicate the policy change to the market and mitigate negative short-term reactions. I would also want to understand the company's assessment of the risk of losing investors due to lower reported earnings, and what contingency plans are in place.
